author: Johng45

review: This is a great device for Amazon.com in that it helps them get you to pay for content. As far as being a device made to stream the content you may already have in your system storage it isn't very good and is poorly thought out from the standpoint of design. Why not make a device that can use the different video wrappers that are out there and have been out there for years. For pete's sake, it doesn't even recognize the original DVD wrapper TS_Video. Nor does it recognize .ISO files. If you want to watch your content encoded in those wrappers or anything but the newest of the new, you'll either have to transcode everything to MKV or use a really buggy adaptor software called Plex. It never worked here and it's GUI is terrible. Forget it. Get a WDTV Play which does everything without extra software that barely works anyway.What a waste of $100 is the Amazon Fire TV*
author: DEAN STRIEPEKE

review: Just hooked up the Fire TV a few days ago. It's surprisingly simple. I didn't even have to ask my son for help. :)  One thing to keep in mind. When they say the remote control battery back is difficult to get off, they are NOT kidding. Honestly, I thought something was wrong with mine. The fact that I was sick and not feeling well didn't help. It did finally come off though, and after that, everything worked perfectly. It's so easy to use and really convenient to have everything right there and awesome to be able to my favorite Amazon shows on the tele instead of the computer. The remote usage takes some getting used to, but I think that's true with any new system. So far, no complaints. I'll update as I get more familiar with it.
author: Christi Durden
